Transcription for 14198

Lanthwaite Major Barron's Close-Off Licence
This building on Boverton Road was built in the 1890s
and is known amongst the locals as the Rocket House.
It was used to house the rocket life-saving apparatus
and also the horse-drawn rescue cart.
During World War II it was used as Lanthwaite Major's gas mask station
and in 1946 the building was sold and became an off-licence.
Its first licensee was Frank Dear.
